result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob M Tuzzolino was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not posses/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with the immediate family of Michael S.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment, schooling or combination of both.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain stable residence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Disposition Form
Associated with Charge #1

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Andrew Herro.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: CP.  PSI author present in court. Victim's family in court.  PSI has been received and reviewed; one correction noted on the record.  Statement from victim's son. Statement from def's mother.  Court questions PSI author.  Argument from State and counsel.  Def stipulates to restitution amount requested.  Statement from def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Presentence Report e-mailed to DA's office & defense counsel
Confidential
Letter received from Atty Giernoth
$20,000 cash bond revoked; Defendant held without bond
Disposition Form
Sentencing hearing on September 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Andrew Herro.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: CP.  Members of victim's family also present.  State moves to amend charge to 2nd Degree Homicide, 940.06(1); Court so orders.  PSI requested w/State to cap recommendation for initial confinement at 5 yrs and free to argue re remainder of sentence.  Def free to argue.  State files and Court reviews Amended Information w/def.  Court questions counsel.  Recess.  Reconvene.  Def enters no contest plea to amended charge.  Court finds def guilty on amended charge and orders presentence investigation be prepared.  Court revokes bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on June 10, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Andrew Herro.  Atty Mark David Bensen for State.  Clerk: CP.  Counsel has reviewed evidence and met w/def.  Counsel expects plea w/PSI being requested and requests separate date be set.  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Hearing on May 25, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Andrew Herro.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: CP.  Autopsy and crime lab results have been rec'd; counsel would like to follow up on measurements done by Sheriff Dept and other info.  Counsel req adj.  Hearing scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary Hearing; 3/15/16
Victim requests to be present for court hearings
Exhibits #1, #2, and #3
Hearing on April 21, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Andrew Herro.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: CP.  Victim's son present in court.  WITNESS:  Det B. McAndrews (WBPD).  Court finds State has met burden and binds def over.  State files and Court reviews Information w/def.  Counsel indicates there is some outstanding discovery - final autopsy report and results from Crime Lab.  Counsel req adj; Court sets FP date (ARGN to be set at a later date).  Hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Based on agreement of all parties Preliminary hearing scheduled 3/4/16 has been rescheduled to 3/15/16 at 1:30; Attorney Herro indicates client in agreement and continues waiver of timing.
Preliminary hearing at 03-15-2016 01:30 pm
Preliminary hearing at 03-04-2016 03:00 pm

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Andrew Herro.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Pretrial held, waiver of timing continues; Preliminary hearing requested, anticipates resolution, waiting for additional information;  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing at 02-10-2016 01:15 pm

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Andrew Herro.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: CP.  Discovery rec'd; additional rec'd yesterday.  Def continues timing waiver.  Counsel req adj.    Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Supply DNA sample; No contact with victim's family, direct or indirect, except may only have contact with fiance MK
Hearing at 01-13-2016 01:15 pm

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Andrew Herro.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Clerk: CP  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court sets $20,000 cash bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver.    Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
